page.description: The SQL::InsertStatement object encapsulates the parsing and properties of a SQL INSERT statement. as a result, it has the most properties. Its children are the various clauses that make up a complete INSERT statement.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script inserts a new record.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim ins as SQL::InsertStatement dim qry as SQL::Query dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim cs as SQL::CallResult dim connString as C dim sql_insert as C dim sql_query as C

section.description: Next, define the connection string and the SQL INSERT statement. Note the syntax of the command. The fields that will receive data and the corresponding values are in two comma delimited sets.
section.example: connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v7\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" sql_insert = "insert into customer (firstname, lastname, bill_city, bill_postal_code, bill_state_region) values ('George', 'Jones', 'Arlington', '02000', 'VA')"

section.description: Open the connection and parse the insert command.
section.example: IF .not. conn.open(connString) THEN end END IF IF .not. ins.parse(sql_insert) THEN ui_msg_box("Error", ins.callresult.text) end END IF

section.description: Insert the new record into the table.
section.example: ins.execute(conn) cs = ins.CallResult ui_msg_box("Call result", cs.Text)

property.name: Arguments
property.description: Read. Arguments for the current query.

property.name: Column
property.description: Read Write. The items in the column list.

property.name: ColumnReferences
property.description: Read. An array of all column references in the query (including nested occurrences). Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ErrorColumn
property.description: Read. The column number of the last error reported by the parser.

property.name: ErrorText
property.description: Read. The text of the last parser error reported.

property.name: FunctionReferences
property.description: Read. An array of all function calls. Behaves the same way as .SelectTableReferences.

property.name: ObjectDefinitions
property.description: Read. For internal debugging purposes. Returns a string description of the mapping between the ANTLR grammar and the Xbasic objects.

property.name: ParseTree
property.description: Read. For internal debugging. A string description of the underlying parse tree.

property.name: SelectTableReferences
property.description: Read. An array of all table references in the from clause and those joined to them. This array is created when the property is requested, but can become out of date. Use the Resynch()function on any variable holding this list when any changes are made.

property.name: SQLStatement
property.description: Read Write. A variable that can be assigned a syntax string without parsing it. If no value is passed to the ::Parse()method, this value is used.

property.name: Table
property.description: Read Write. The table to be inserted into.

property.name: Value
property.description: Read Write. An array of all column values be set.

property.name: XML
property.description: Read Write. Creates XML from the tree or recreates the tree from the XML.

method.name: Execute
method.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and executes the current SELECT statement on that or its current connection.

methodref.name: GenerateNativeSyntax
methodref.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and executes the current SELECT statement on that or its current connection. Returns the string that the .Execute()or .Validate()methods would pass to the connection. Note: This string is target syntax specific.

methodref.name: Parse
methodref.description: Accepts an optional text string and parses it. If the parse is successful, the elements of the SQL statement will be available immediately as Properties of the object.

methodref.name: Reset
methodref.description: Reinitializes the object as if it had just been declared.

methodref.name: Validate
methodref.description: Accepts an optional SQL::Connection object or connection string and validates the current SELECT statement on the connection that is passed or the current connection.
